pkgmetadata.longdescription:
emacs-ycmd is a client for ycmd, the code completion system.
For (C-c Y <cmd>) key bindings see, https://github.com/abingham/emacs-ycmd/blob/master/ycmd.el#L610

use.flag: Adds basic support for in-place completion.
Adds support for company-mode for text completion.
Enables enhanced debug reporting.
Adds eldoc support for displaying function args and a variable purpose.
Integrates flycheck syntax checking.
Adds support for the Go programming language via go-mode.
Adds next-error integration for inspecting errors in sequential forward or reverse order.
Adds support for the Rust programming language via rust-mode for syntax highlighting, indentation, cargo integration.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system gocode. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd gocode.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system godef. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd godef.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system gopls. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd gopls.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system JDT.LS settings. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd JDT.LS default settings for workspace and extensions.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system mono; Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd mono.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system OmniSharp. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd OmniSharp.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system racerd. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd racerd.
Configures emacs-ycmd to use the system rust. Otherwise, fallback to the internal ycmd rust.
Adds support for the TypeScript programming language via typescript-mode.
Set up ycmd for compatibility with core version 43
Set up ycmd for compatibility with core version 44
Set up ycmd for compatibility with core version 45
